error_msg: The parameters for Kernel Shap should be one of ['categorical_features', 'sample_background_data', 'n_background_samples', 'sampling_method'].
description: Kernel SHAP is a method for approximating SHAP values to explain the output of machine learning models by attributing contributions of each feature to the model's prediction. A brackground data set is used to estimate feature attributions and establish a baseline for the calculation of SHAP values. In this case, the training data is used as background data.

oneOf.error_msg: The parameter 'sample_background_data' must be of type boolean, it must be 'true' if you want to sample your background dataset.
oneOf.description: 'true' if the background data must be sampled, otherwise the entire train data set is used. Smaller datasets speed up the algorithm run time.

oneOf.error_msg: A whole number greater than or equal to 1 must be entered.
oneOf.description: If the parameter 'sample_background_data' is 'true', the number of background data samples to be drawn.

oneOf.error_msg: The 'sampling_method' parameter should be one of null, 'shuffle' or 'kmeans'.
oneOf.description: If the parameter 'sample_background_data' is 'true', whether to sample random samples with 'shuffle' option or summarize the data set with 'kmeans' option. If 'categorical_features' is 'true', 'shuffle' options used by default.
